intro: Stachys burgsdorffioides subsp. ladanoides, commonly known as the woolly betony, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright stems covered in dense, soft hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. The plant produces spikes of pale blue to purple flowers, which bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and also bear a fuzzy texture. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
